Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Brownie \Brown"ie\, n. [So called from its supposed tawny or swarthy color.] An imaginary good-natured spirit, who was supposed often to perform important services around the house by night, such as thrashing, churning, sweeping. [Scot.] [1913 Webster]
brownie n 1: (folklore) fairies that are somewhat mischievous [syn: {elf}, {hob}, {gremlin}, {pixie}, {pixy}, {imp}] 2: square or bar of very rich chocolate cake usually with nuts
